item.title: Smoothstone’s Converged IP Cloud Expanding To Europe
item.description:
Smoothstone IP Communications, a pioneering company in cloud-based unified communications, is expanding its services to include European locations. This expansion begs the question: is this the beginning of a global cloud network? The answer is a resounding yes. International MPLS connectivity makes it possible to extend any IP service to any location worldwide. The power of MPLS networks lies in their ability to transport data seamlessly to users regardless of their location...

item.title: Prisoner voting is now a legal issue under EU legislation.
item.description:
Jo Shaw, Salvesen Chair of European Institutions Article 39(2) of the Charter of Fundamental Rights states: ‘European Parliament members shall be chosen through direct, universal suffrage in a free and secret ballot.’ The Grand Chamber of the Court of Justice, in a concise and understated judgment in Delvigne (Case C-650/13; ECLI:EU:C:2015:648) delivered on October 6, 2015, provided further definition to this provision. It found that national policies determining voter eligibility in European Parliament elections fall under EU law’s purview, as they implement EU law according to Article 51(1) of the Charter of Fundamental Rights...

item.title: Fiber Optic Connections from USA to Paris, France
item.description:

item.title: Opinions of the Attorney General on recent CJEU cases regarding national data retention laws
item.description:
Lorna Woods, Professor of Internet Law, University of Essex Introduction Advocate General Campos Sanchez-Bordana has presented his opinions on three cases concerning data retention: SpaceNet and Telekom Deutschland, GD v Commissioner of the Garda Síochána, and VD and SR. These opinions are the latest development in a series of legal challenges related to data retention that began with an Irish challenge to the Data Retention Directive. The Data Retention Directive, which allowed for the retention of communications data under certain exceptions to privacy principles, was invalidated in the Digital Rights Ireland case...

item.title: Hainan Airlines is now offering flights from China to France
item.description:
Hainan Airlines has introduced a fifth European route to its network, joining existing services to Moscow, Saint Petersburg, Brussels, and Berlin. The inaugural flight, HU7907, departed Hangzhou International Airport on September 3rd, with a stopover at Xi’an Xianyang International Airport before continuing to Paris’ Roissy-Charles de Gaulle Airport. Source: Hainan Airlines. The ribbon-cutting ceremony for the first flight on September 3. This new service aims to enhance political, economic, and cultural ties between China and France, especially as 2014 marks the 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations between the two nations...
